Exaggerate: President Trump exaggerated the size of the defense budget by claiming it to be the "most amount ever" when it is not.
Understate: The claim understates the actual amount of defense spending by only considering budget authority, which is different from budget outlays.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the defense spending next year will indeed be $716 billion, as it only provides information about budget authority.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that budget authority is equivalent to actual spending, which is not the case.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the claim, such as the fact that previous years had higher defense budget authority when adjusted for inflation.
